This video made me cry big happy mushy tears. Thank you @najibgomez for capturing our love so beautifully! Video from our 23-day Yoga Teacher Training is live on YouTube (link in bio)🧘‍♀️🤸‍♀️❤️ We have a few spots open for next years trainings if you’re looking to transform your life and co-create magic with us. x @yogagirlofficial @island.yoga #islandyogaYTT #yogagirL #community

Day 2 of 16oz of celery juice a day... About a thousand people have told me to give this a try so let’s see what this does! I have officially been sick for an entire month now so open to everything. Today is the final day of our YTT and I’m getting ready to R E S T.
Any celery juice drinkers out there with some advice? Has it improved your health? Tell me! Thanks @medicalmedium for the tip🌱 #celeryjuice

I’m not pregnant! Not even a little bit (if there is such a thing)!😂 One day we will have a second baby but not right now. When I say I’m going on maternity leave I mean with the one baby I already have - I never took any time of when Lea Luna was born. I taught 8 weeks of retreats and trainings the year I had her; the first one she was only 4 weeks old (what was I thinking!!?)🙈 I never stopped working. I hired more people and learned how to delegate but I never stopped. So... Right now, I’m trying to find a way to slow down and live at a different pace. I’ll still be leading retreats and trainings, of course. Next year I have almost 20 weeks of programs. That’s close to half the year, immersed 24/7 in trainings and retreats and groups. It’s an amazing gig! I love, love, love teaching. I just don’t think I should be working a second full time job at the same time. If you’re leading a 23-day training you should probably use your early mornings and late evenings to rest, not to continue working. So. I’m thinking next year I’ll create a Rachel-appropriate version of maternity leave that works for me. Trainings and retreats remain. The podcast, too (I’d never leave that ever!). Recording this weeks episode in a bit to see if I can wrap my head around what this next phase in my life will bring. ⁣
⁣
I love you all. Thank you for being here and for holding this space. x⁣
⁣
Photo by @wildernessstories

Life takes you where you’re supposed to go. I forget about that, often. So I remind myself. Often. This little app has been that for me for so many years; reminders of things I need to hear. This is why I talk about self-love, or forgiveness, or healing, or letting go. Not because I have it all together but because inside of myself, I tend to fall apart. My whole life is made up by a string of broken things I have tried to make whole. People, mostly. I almost always fail because other people are not ours to fix. Not our parents or our siblings or our spouses or our friends. Not even our children - but we can do everything in our might to keep them whole and safe along the way. Truth is, we can’t fix anyone else. We can only fix ourselves. And when I need that reminder, that the world is not mine to save and that all is well and to trust and to breathe, I write it down and post it here. It’s not just for you, the things I share. It’s also for me. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Instagram became a way for me to speak everything out loud; my fears, my hopes, my dreams. My struggles. I know that much of what I feel, other people feel too. But lately, I’ve been struggling. A lot. I don’t know how to communicate it so I don’t. Sometimes it’s easy, sharing what’s truly real. Right now it isn’t. Maybe I’m tired of sharing. I know I’m tired of judgement. Tired of fixing so many broken things. Or maybe I’m just tired and this is the first vacation I have taken in 6 years and not doing anything is making me weirdly agitated. I’m not sure. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
I have a feeling I’m exiting. From what, I don’t know. Toward what, I have no clue. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
I know I wish I could stay here, on this dock, by this ocean. Then I remember... It’s the same ocean I have at home. I just never sit by it anymore. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Life takes you where you’re supposed to go. And I’m going home. x⁣
⁣
#vacation #home #bonaire #bellafontepenthouse405
We’re going offline for a little bit! Need time to rest and restore. See you soon. x

We stay in this bay for what feels like an eternity - we are lost in time. The beach is made up by pieces of white coral, broken off the reef by nature and time and then washed up on shore. I lie down and let the sunshine warm my bones. I don’t care about sunscreen. I care about her. She goes up and down our little sliver of coral beach more times than I can count, picking up pieces of rock and throwing them into the sea. It’s like she’s giving the ocean back pieces of herself, determined, one at a time. For a while she just stands with her feet in the water, looking out at the shades of blue. “Where did Pappa go?” she asks, surprising me as always with her newfound ability to string words together. How did she get so big? Time stands still and moves much too quickly all at once. I take her hand in mine and point at the ocean. “Pappa is diving” I say. “Over there. See? He’ll be back soon”. She looks at me and then back at the ocean. “Pappa diving.” Diving is a new word. She pronounces it tentatively, tasting it in her mouth for the first time. “Pappa diving. Back soon.” She looks out at the horizon, accepting what I’ve told her fully. In her life, everyone always comes back soon. No one is missing for too long. We are complete also when we are apart. ⁣
⁣
I think about all the people I’ve lost and how I’ll never look at a Back Soon with that kind of trust. Even now, in this perfect moment, I wonder how long Dennis will be. If the dive is going well. If an hour has passed. But I guess that’s what life is. We lose so we can find. And in the end... I found her. Or maybe she found me.⁣
⁣
She bends over to pick up another piece of coral. I sit there and I love her. ⁣
⁣
For as long as I live, it’s where I’ll be.
